data.text: Do I Need a Bike Lock for Travelling Through Europe?

Hey team, bike locks, what do you carry and how do you which to get. I'm going to be riding through Europe and potentially though a lot of urban areas. Do I need a lock? And if so how hefty should I go? For reference I am going to be interesting euro velo 6 a lot though Switzerland Germany Austria Slovenia and Hungry.
I live in Germany and I would say it depends where you want to stay/travel. In larger cities you need a good lock but outside of these areas I often bike without a lock or only a small one.
data.author: Silvio Schlöffel

data.text: it will be a really mix, I am stopping in Munich Vienna and brateslava but also rural villages. Hmm OK looks like I will need a good one.
data.author: Sufyan Saleem

data.text: I love Abus as a brand, and have their Granit U-lock which is pretty heavy duty, though relatively light weight, and their Bordo Lite, which is slightly less secure, but weighs less than 500g and folds up tiny. Depends on what level of security you think you need, but as far a brand and range of products, can’t go wrong with Abus.
data.author: Erik Jansen

data.text: yeah truth is I don't know what level of security I need. I've not used a lock in many years and usually on bike packing trips I never leave my bike(2/3) days. Over a month I will have to at some points.
data.author: Sufyan Saleem

data.text: Yeah, it's such a hard call to make. Generally, if I'm leaving my bike out of my sight but in plain view in a busier area where I would expect people in general to object to someone obviously stealing a bike, I tend to think the Bordo is fine, but if I think I'm going to be locking up in relatively quiet areas, or on side streets, or certainly overnight, I definitely do a u-lock. Even then, it's not guarantee. Try just always locking up next to a nicer looking bike with a less sturdy looking lock? Remember, your bike doesn't have to be impossible to steal, just harder to steal than the one it's locked up next to.
data.author: Erik Jansen

data.text: Agree with Bordi light as it’s super lightweight and a decent lock. Then I would get a motorcycle alarm that you can stick in one of your bags and activate by remote to at least make a lot of noise if somebody tries to take your bike.￼
